page.title: 05A day at Whisstock's boaty'd
page.content: Mr Whisstock starts work at 8.00am and has a walk around to make sure the boatyard is all right. Then he goes into his office and reads the mail. He often gets mail in foreign languages. Mr whisstock designs and makes pleasure boats. First he has to draw a picture of the boat before he and his team can make it. He has a long job working out how much the boat costs. It usually costs between Â£100,000 and Â£400,000. Most boats take about two months to make. The boatyard makes about six boats a year. After the boat is made Mr whisstock and his employees fit a fridge,a toilet and other things like that inside the boat to furnish it. {St. Mary's.}
